docs.title: Infection Prevention Policy
docs.heading: Contact Precautions - When to Use
docs.text: Use Contact Precautions when residents have suspected or confirmed infections transmitted by direct contact or contaminated surfaces. Ensure appropriate PPE and dedicated equipment as indicated.

docs.title: Infection Prevention Policy
docs.heading: Outbreak Escalation and Reporting
docs.text: Escalate clusters of symptoms to the Infection Preventionist and Administrator-on-Call. Initiate line listing and follow facility outbreak reporting workflow. Notify appropriate agencies per current requirements.

docs.title: CDC Infection Control Guidance (General)
docs.heading: Standard Precautions - Core Elements
docs.text: Standard Precautions apply to all residents regardless of suspected or confirmed infection status. Key elements include hand hygiene, PPE based on exposure risk, and respiratory hygiene/cough etiquette.

docs.title: NYSDOH Infection Prevention Guidance (Reference)
docs.heading: Reporting (NY) - What to Consider
docs.url_or_location: NYSDOH (health.ny.gov) — add exact page in your curated library
docs.text: Follow New York State reporting requirements for outbreaks and reportable diseases as applicable. Maintain documentation of notifications and required forms.

docs.title: CMS Interpretive Guidance (Sample Entry)
docs.heading: Survey Expectations - Infection Control
docs.url_or_location: CMS.gov / Appendix PP — add exact binder location
docs.text: Maintain infection prevention practices, staff training, and documentation supporting implementation of policies and procedures.
